p: Annona muricata, commonly known as soursop, belongs to the Annonaceae family. The plant is widely known for its anticancer properties [ 15]. Aside this popular medicinal use, a wide range of ethnomedicinal activities have also been attributed to different parts of the plant owing to some of its properties including anti-inflammatory, antiproliferative, hypoglycemic, sedative, smooth muscle relaxant and antispasmodic effects [ 16, 17]. Some indigenous communities in Africa including Nigeria use A. muricata in their folk medicine. Leaf extract of the plant is used to alleviate difficulty associated with urination in certain communities in Eastern part of Nigeria. Although Asare et al. [ 18] reported that the aqueous extract of the plant leaf exhibited antiproliferative activity against BPH-1 cells, there is still paucity of information on the possible usefulness of this plant in the treatment of BPH.
